byline.contributor: Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

abstract: Residents of Aleppo, Syria, hardened by four years of war, carry on semblance of normal life amid days of extreme violence following failure of truce brokered by United States and Russia; routine activities mix with scenes of tragedy and constant threat of death.

headline.print_headline: Aleppo Flinches  as Syrian Truce Falls to Violence
headline.main: On the Ground in Aleppo: Bloodshed, Misery and Hope

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: The New York Times’s Cairo bureau chief reported from Aleppo, Syria, where inhabitants try to carry on despite a civil war’s inescapable reality.
lead_paragraph: The New York Times’s Cairo bureau chief reported from Aleppo, Syria, where inhabitants try to carry on despite a civil war’s inescapable reality.
